title: Chicken korma

ingredients.content: 1 brown onion (approx. 120 g), cut into halves
1000 g boneless skinless chicken thighs, cut into cubes (2-3 cm)

preparations.content: Place bay leaves, cardamom pods, cloves, cinnamon quill and 1 tablespoon of the oil into mixing bowl and cook <b>5 min/Varoma/speed 1<b>, until fragrant. Transfer into a bowl and set aside. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Place almonds into mixing bowl and mill <b>10 sec/speed 9<b>.
Add garlic paste, ginger paste and onion and chop <b>3 sec/speed 5<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add cumin, coriander, turmeric, salt, chilli powder and remaining 1 tablespoon oil and cook <b>6 min/100°C/speed 2<b>.
Add cream, water and tomato paste and blend <b>5 sec/speed 6<b>.

Add reserved spiced oil mixture and cook <b>6 min/100°C/speed 2<b>, then blend <b>1 min/speed 1<b> <b>-10, increasing speed gradually from speed 1 to speed 10<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add chicken, stir well with aid of spatula, then cook <b>15-17 min/100°C//speed 1<b>, until chicken is cooked through.
Add garam masala and stir well with aid of spatula. Transfer into a serving bowl and garnish with fried shallots before serving.

hintsAndTricks: You can replace the almonds with raw unsalted cashews, if preferred. You can also replace the cream with natural yoghurt or coconut milk, if preferred.
To make your own garlic paste, ginger paste and garam masala, please refer to the recipes on this recipe chip.
Fried shallots can be found in the international aisle of supermarkets and at Asian and Indian grocers.
Serve with natural yoghurt, if desired
